meanings.definition: Resembling or containing meal; powdery or granular in texture.
meanings.sent1: The mealy sand on the beach felt soft under my feet.
meanings.sent2: The baker used mealy flour to make the cake crumbly.
meanings.sent3: The mealy clouds in the sky looked like powdered sugar sprinkled over blue frosting.
meanings.sent4: Her mealy skin after swimming in the pool all day resembled a sandy desert.
meanings.sent5: The mealy dust settled on the old book, giving it a vintage appearance.

meanings.sent1: The mealy cookie broke apart easily in my hand.
meanings.sent2: The stale bread was mealy and unpleasant to eat.
meanings.sent3: The mealy sandcastle collapsed as soon as the wave touched it.
meanings.sent4: His mealy voice cracked as he tried to speak after crying.
meanings.sent5: The mealy soil in the garden made it difficult for plants to grow strong roots.

meanings.sent1: The mealy donuts were coated with powdered sugar.
meanings.sent2: The mealy leaves on the ground crunched under my feet.
meanings.sent3: The mealy cat left a trail of flour wherever it walked in the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: Her mealy hands were evidence of her baking adventures.
meanings.sent5: The mealy snow on the mountain sparkled in the sunlight like diamonds.
